title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: South Park Elementary, day. The bell rings. The fourth graders are still chatting as Mr. Garrison enters.

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: Okay, children, let's take our seats. Did you take attendance, Mr. Slave?

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: All donesy wunsy.

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: Okay, let's all take out our math homework and go over the problems.

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: Mmmath homework, Mmmath homework. Where did I file that?

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: Oh, and by the way, children, there's a walkout scheduled today to protest the war in Iraq. So, uh, if you're against the war, run along outside, and if you're for the war, uh, stay here and we'll do math problems.

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: South Park Elementary, front entrance. The door open and all the kids run out. A cloud of paper signals their exit. Some of them twirl with delight. The boys come out singing

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: We got out of schoo-l! No more school toda-ay!

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: What should we do?

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: Let's go see a movie!

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: No war! No war!  No war! No war!  No war! No war!  No war! No war! No war!

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: No war, m'kay?! No war, m'kay?! Oh uh, here you go, boys.  These will help you protest. It's good to see that you care about peace, boys, m'kay? No war, m'kay?!

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: Excuse me, boys.  Tom Stansel, HBC news. Can you kids tell me why you marched out of school today?

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: Uh... war?

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: Right. What about the war?

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: Ih ih ih-t's g-gay?

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: Uh huh, and what aspect of it do you think is most gay?

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: Uuuh, n-no blood for oil.

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: Yeah.  War is not my voice.

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: Bush is a Naizi

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: Hey all you unAmerican bastards! If you don't like America, why don't you git out?!

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: Don't you call us unAmerican! This country was founded on the right to protest! M'kay?

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: Yeah! Right!

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: If the Founding Fathers saw you burning your flag an' callin' the President a Nazi, they'd roll over in their grave!

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: Yeah! Right!

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: The Founding Fathers would agree with our right to protest!

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: Foundin' Fathers would kick all your asses!

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: Boys, what do you think the Founding Fathers would say?

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: ...Eh the... Founding who?

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: South Park Elementary, Garrison's classroom. He stares at the children angrily, his arms crossed

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: Well, I hope you little Commies are pretty pleased with yourselves!  Going out there and protesting America, and then saying on national television that you don't even know who the Founding Fathers are! You kids don't know squat about America, do you?!

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: Mmuh well, not really, no.

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: Well that's just jingles! Because I'm assigning all you little flag-burners a full report on seventeen seventy-siyix, and the Founding Fathers!

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: Awwwwww!

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: SHUT UP! I want you all in your study groups of four, and if you can't give an outstanding report on what the Founding Fathers would have to say about all this protesting, then it's Fs for you!

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: Ugh. UGHuh.  I can't do it! This is waaay too much material for a nine-year-old!

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: Oh no you don't, Cartman! Every time we get put in a study group, you sit on your ass while the rest of us do all the work!

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: But you guys are such better studiers than me. I know you can pull it off.

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: You're gonna read this stuff and study like the rest of us!

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: Maaaa. M-maaaa.

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: Shut up and study!

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: Maaaa. Mah mah mh.  Hmmm, 1776. When our Founding Fathers created America. I wonder what it used to be like in those days?  In those days? In those days? In those days?

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: What are you doing?

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: I'm trying to have a flashback.

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: (A what?)

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: You know. If I have a flashback, then I can see what 1776 was like first-hand!

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: No, you just have to study.

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: Nonono. I've seen this work before. Just give me a second.  Oh okay, okay. How about this: Say guys, 1776 was so long ago. I wonder what life would have been like back then?  Back then? Back then? Back then?  Um... Oh waitwait, I know, I know! Heheh, you know guys, I don't even care about 1776. It was so long ago, that I don't think it has anything to do with me.  With me. With... anything to do with me. With me.

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: That isn't gonna work, dumbass!

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: Kids, let's keep it down for study group, or else Mr. Garrison is going to punish me.

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: Just face it, Cartman. You're gonna have to study!

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: Maaaaa. Meh mameh, Maaaaa!

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: South Park Avenue. The opposing groups face each other in front of the tallest building in town. Skeeter paints a line across the span of the street and looks up

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: There! All finished. From now on, this is the pro-war side of town, and that's the unpatriotic side.

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: How about we call this the rational side of town, and that the redneck side?!

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: Hahahaha, yeah.

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: You just keep all your flag burnin' and your hippie-rock protest songs on YOUR side o' the town!

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: Hey wait a minute, your side of town has the post office.

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: Well your side has the grocery store.

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: Well you can come to our side of town to use the post office and we can go to your side to use the grocery store.

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: Aaah, can we cross the line to take our kids to school?

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: W-hell, naturally you could cross the line for that. Just like ...we could cross the line for hardware, supplies, gas, and pharmaceutical needs.

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: Yup, yes sir, yeah, right, uh huh.

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: Hey everybody, this is never going to work. Don't you see? All this dividin' up the town, it's just ridiculous. What we really should be doing, is just beatin' the hell out of each other like we were.

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: He's right.  Boy, do I feel like a fool.

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: Cartman's house, upstairs. The boys walk down the hallway and reach Cartman's room. He's rigged up a way to ... knock himself out. Three pulley wheels and a nail guide a string tied to the door across the entrance, up the wall, and back to the top of the door entrance. At the other end of the string is a big rock.

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: Cartman, what the hell are you doing?! You're suppsoed to be studying!

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: That's what I'm doing. I'm about to find out all about what happened back in 1776.

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: How?!

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: All I have to do is be thinking about American history when I walk through this doorway. I'll trip the rope, causing the rock to fall on my head. And then I will have a flashback to the times of our Founding Fathers!

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: Cartman, you are hereby declared a full-fledged retard!

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: Haha, make fun of me all you want, Kyle! But I will have the last laugh. Gentlemen, if you will clear the doorway, please? Oh Gee. I wonder what it used to be like in the year 1776.

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: Cartman? Cartman??

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: Benjamin Franklin?

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: No, turdpants, it's Kyle!

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: Kyle! Get out of my flashback, you God-damned Jew!

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: City Hall, day. Both sides of the war issue are in the office.

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: Rabble! Rabble! Rabble! Rabble! Rabble! Rabble! Rabble! Rabble! Rabble!

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: Okay, people. What are we rabbling about now?

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: Mayor, our peace rally has always been set for this Saturday! Now, these pro-war bastards are suddenly trying to say they get the town square.

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: That's bullcrap, Mayor! Our rally to support the war was set up months ago!

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: There was no war months ago!

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: Hey, if you don't like America, then you can git out!

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: Look, nobody wants to hear a bunch of twangy country music prowar proopaganda!

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: Well nobody wants to hear a bunch o' rock protest songs!

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: Well up yours, rednecks!

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: Rabble! Rabble! Rabble! Rabble! Rabble! Rabble! Rabble! Rabble! Rabble!

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: Quiet people! The town square is public space. That means if neither group will nicely and maturely move the day of its rally, I'll just have have to give the town square to both groups.

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: All right, that's fine! Because our war support songs will be a thousand times better!

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: Oh, you think so? Bring the shizzle!

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: We'll trizzle the shizzle all over the hizzle!

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: Yeah?! See you Saturday, makizzer shanna sharilla shaz biuznatch gazizzah!

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: Cartman's house, night. The front door opens and in walk the boys.

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: Cartman?

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: Cartman? You'd better be studying, God-damnit!

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: Ah, Stan, Kyle, Kenny, you're just in time.

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: Oh no...

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: Oh yes! I am just about to flash back to the days of our Foundig Fathers!

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: Cartman, you're supposed to be studying! What the hell is all this?!

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: I have programmed TiVo to record over fifty hours of the History channel. When TiVo is full, both TiVo and I will be dropped into the water, combining our electrowhatever fields and sending me into a flashback of history!

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: Uh Cartman, I think that's a really bad idea.

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: Or a really sweet one.

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: Your TiVo is full.

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: Whoa, here it goes!

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: Cartman?  Cartman??

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: Aww crap.

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: The flashback. Cartman is seen in period dress, face down on a dirt road. He comes to, looks up, sits up and looks around, then notices his clothes. He quickly rises and looks at Philadelphia in the distance.

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: Ohhh awesome!!!

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: Worthy young lad, are you all right?

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: Yeah yeah. Can you tell me what year it is?

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: This year? Why it's 1776, it is.

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: Oho yes! I did it I did it!

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: Would you like a ride into town? I'm on my way to Master Thomas Jefferson's hosue to get a very important document, I am.

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: Oho kick fucking ass, dude!

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: Never seen you around here, friend. Might you be from up North?

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: No, I'm not from here at all. I'm having a flashback.

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: A flashback? Why, what is that?

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: Well you know, it's a...  H-ho, awesome!

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
role: Look at me, I'm back in time, in 1776.

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
role: With gaslight corners, cobblestone streets, and humble houses
text: made of bricks.

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
role: What a special magic time, and it's all alive for me

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
role: I'm so glad Stan and Kyle aren't here. I hate those guys, seriously.

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
role: Seriuosly hate those guys. Hate Stan and Kyle.

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: Hell's Pass Hospital, day, Cartman's recovery room. Cartman's mom sits by his bed as Stan and Kyle look on. Dr. Doctor enters

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: Is he going to be all right, doctor??

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: Your son tried to kill himself in a ritualistic fashion I've never seen before. His chances of surviving are very slim. I'm so sorry.

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: Oh baby baby, you can't die.

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: Yeah. We have a report to do, asshole! Get up! Get up!!

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: Whoa. Easy, Kyle.

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: But it's not fair! We have to do a full report on the Founding Fathers, and Cartman got out of helping us again!

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: I gues we're just gonna have to do it with the three of us! Come on, guys!

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: I know you're in a very dark place now, sweetie. But you must come toward the light! Come toward the light!

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: Flashback, night. The driver and Cartman approach Jefferson's house.

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: Here we are, then. The current residence of Master Thomas Jefferson.

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: Super neato!

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: I'm afraid you'll have to wait here.

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: But, I need to talk to the Founding Fathers to do my report.

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: Sorry. Only the official messenger boy is allowed to talk to Mister Jefferson

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: Oh, okay.I guess I understand.  I don't wanna wait for our life to be over... I don't wanna wait for our life to be over...

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: Hello. I am Thomas Jefferson.

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: And I am the official messenger boy, I am.

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: Very well. Take this document to the Continental Congress.

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: Wow, the Declaration of Independence Day.

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: Some favir going to war with England and others want to avoid war at all cost.

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: It's a bitch, ain't it?

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: Perhaps this document will make the reasons for war obvious to all. Good luck, young messenger!  Now make haste!

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: Stan's house, day. Kyle, Stan, and Kenny study at the coffee table in the living room

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: Okay, so Thomas Jefferson wrote the Declaration of Independence, then the Continental Congress-

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: No war! No war! No war!

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: Oh, Jesus...

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: Uh, boys, would you mind clearing the living room. We have to practice our big war protest song.

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: Dad, we have to study. Mr. Garrison is making us do a presentation on what the Founding Fathers would say about the war.

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: Hey... That's a terrific idea!

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: Yeah! We could have the boys do their presentation as part of our peace rally on Saturday!

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: Oh, no, nononono.

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: Support our troops! Support our troops! Support our troops!

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: See? I told you they had your son.

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: Kenny. What are you doing over here with all these unAmerican traitors?!

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: (I'm doing my homework.)

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: The boys are going to give a presentation at our rally about how the Founding Fathers would agree with our right to protest!

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: Actually, we hadn't really come to a decision-

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: Look! My son is a patriot and LOVES his country!  Come on, Kenny!

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: (But Dad, I-)

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: NOW!

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: Yeah!

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: Support our troops! Support our troops! Support our troops! Support our troops!

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: Kenny, no- ohhh! Awww.  Awww, now we lost two in our study group!

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: God damnit!

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: Can you believe those hick sons of bitches? Manipulating those kids to be on their side.

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: Disgraceful! Stan and Kyle, it's up to you to show all those war-mongerers that the Founding Fathers agree with us!

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: Yeah, that's right!

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: Come on, guys!

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: Get back to work!

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: Do you think kids in every town have to deal with this crap?

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: Philadelphia, day. Independence Hall is shown. Cartman enters and finds the Congress room. The doors open before him

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: Enter, young messenger.  I am John Hancock, President of the Congress.

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: Wow.

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: Mr. John Adams?

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: Aye.

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: Will you do the honors of reading the document to Congress, please?

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: WHEN in the Course of human Events, it becomes necessary for one People to rise up-  -we mutually pledge to each other our Lives, our Fortunes, and our sacred Honor.

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
role: P.S. - Every Thursday should be Free Ice Cream Day. [rolls up
text: the Declaration. Cartman looks around]

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: Excuse me, but does this Declaration actually suggest that we should go to go war with England?

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: We have no choice, Mr. Dickinson.

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: South Park, day. The town square stage. On stage are decorations for the two sides. On the left is a large peace sign on a green curtain surrounded by peace signs and protest signs, on the right is a large eagle surrounded by yellow ribbons. Both groups are on stage

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: All right everyone, thank you all for comin' out to protest the war, m'kay? .

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: Don't kid yourselves. These people have come out to support our troops, right?!

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: And now, Randy Marsh is gonna sing a protest song he wrote about the war.

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: Oh no you don't! We're doing our pro-war song first!

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: Yeah! The last thing these people want is a bleedin'-heart rock protest song!

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: People, I told you, you have to share the stage.

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: Nobody wants to here another pro-war country song!

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: Well excuse me if...

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: Well I'm a little bit rock-n-roll!

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: I'm a little for supportin' our troops.

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: And I'm a little for bringin' them home.

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: I believe freedom isn't free.

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: No, but war shouldn't be our goal.

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: We must defend our country.

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: If it means war, then we say NO!

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: Yeehaw!

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
role: Did you forget them towers in New York?

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
role: Did you forget how it made you feel

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
role: To see them towers come down?

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
role: Were you like me? Did you think it weren't real?

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: I like to rock, but I don't wanna rock Iraq!

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
role: The only kind of rockin' America should do is the kind that we
text: can all dance to, yeah!

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: We got GPS, ICBMs, and good old-fashioned lead.

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
role: We're gonna show Saddam what America means; that son of a bitch
text: will be dead.

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: Why are we fightin' this war?

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
role: There's a man in the office we didn't vote for.

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
role: They didn't give me a choice.

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
role: War is not my voice! Yeaaaaahhhh!

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: Philadelphia, day, Independence Hall. There's plenty of argument going on

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: We must go to war!

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: But what about the violence?! The lives lost?! If we found a country, it should be founded on peace and diplomacy.

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: England will only understand one thing: Force.

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: I must state again for the record that South Carolina, North Carolina, Pennsylvania, Maryland, and Georgia are against war!

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: Yeah, because you don't care about the fate of the Colonies like we do! You're all unpatriotic! And if you don't like the Colonies, then you can git out!

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: Don't you call us unpatriotic! We're protesting this war because we care so deeply for the fate of our Colonies! You are all unpatriotic for leading the Colonies into a war that half of them don't want!

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: Whoa, how very very relevant.

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: South Park, day, town square. The rally is still going on, and a reporter files the following report

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: Tom, I'm standing in the town square where the war rally has been going on for an incredible eighty-seven hours. The crowd still appears to be split right down the middle - half of them support country music, and the other half rock-n-roll. Let's listen in.

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: And now we'd like to bring out a couple of very special South Park students who did a report on what the Founding Fathers would have to say about the war.

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: Booooo!!

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: For you people who still think war is the answer, perhaps you can listen to the voices ... of the children.

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: Uh, we didn't do it.

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: What?

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: We didn't do our homework.

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: Boys! You were supposed to come out here and tell everyone about the Founding Fathers!

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: Well, first we lost one study partner when Cartman put himself in the hospital, and then they took Kenny away, and then Kyle forgot to set his clock ahead for Dalight Saving, so we couldn't find anything in the history books about Iraq and then-

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: That's because the Founding Fathers would have supported the war!

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: The Founding Fathers would have protested like us!

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: Support!

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: Protest!

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: Country!

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: Rock-n-roll!

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: the two sides charge at each other on stage, then off stage. They attack each other with their signs. One man drives his "War is not my voice" sign straight down into another man's head. A man drives his "Bush is a Nazi" sign up a woman's nose after she swats him with her "Support Your Troops" sign. A woman strikes someone else down with her "No Blood for Oil" sign. Stan and Kyle just look on

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: Philadelphia, day, Independence Hall. There's plenty of argument still going on

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: Rabble Rabble Rabble Rabble Rabble Rabble Rabble Rabble Rabble Rabble Rabble Rabble!

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: We cannot found a country based on war!

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: We cannot found a country that is afraid to fight!

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: Rabble!

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: Rabble Rabble Rabble Rabble Rabble Rabble Rabble!  Oh my, it's Benjamin Franklin. It's Benjamin Franklin. It's Benjamin Franklin.

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: Oh, it's Benjamin Franklin. It's Benjamin Franklin. It's Benjamin Franklin.

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: Mr. Franklin, where do you stand on the war issue?

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: I believe that if we are to form a new country, we cannot be a country that appears war-hungry and violent to the rest of the world. However, we also cannot be a country that appears weak and unwilling to fight to the rest of the world. So, what if we form a country that appears to want both?

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: Yes. Yes of course. We go to war, and protest going to war at the same time.

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: Right. If the people of our new country are allowed to do whatever they wish, then some will support the war and some will protest it.

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: And that means that as a nation, we could go to war with whomever we wished, but at the same time, act like we didn't want to. If we allow the people to protest what the government does, then the country will be forever blameless.

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: It's like having your cake, and eating it, too.

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: Think of it: an entire nation founded on saying one thing and doing another.

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: And we will call that country the United States of America.

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: Wow, I get it now! I get it!  Whoa, here it goes. I wish I could go back to my time. To my time, to, to my time.

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: Hell's Pass Hospital, day, Cartman's room. Cartman comes to and looks around

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: Wow!

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: South Park, town square. The townsfolk are still attacking each other and killing more of their number. One man kills another with a "PEACE NOW" sign. A war supporter runs a flag pole through a protester, then pulls it back out again. Stan, Kyle, and Kenny watch from the other end of the square, towards the stage as the carnage continues

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: Everyone, stop! Please!

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: The-the child! The child, from the hospital.

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: If you all don't mind, I would like to do my report now. I know what the founding fathers would say.

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: He does?

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: He does?

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: I learned somethin' today. This country was founded by some of the smartest thinkers the world has ever seen. And they knew one thing: that a truely great country can go to war, and at the same time, act like it doesn't want to. You people who are for the war, you need the protesters. Because they make the country look like it's made of sane, caring individuals. And you people who are anti-war, you need these flag-wavers, because, if our whole country was made up of nothing but soft pussy protesters, we'd get taken down in a second. That's why the founding fathers decided we should have both. It's called "having your cake and eating it too."

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: He's right. The strength of this country is the ability to do one thing and say another.

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: Yeah, but... if it weren't for all you guys protesting, why everyone around the world would hate the American people instead of just the President.

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: And if it weren't for you people flexing your arms, America could easily get taken over by terrorists or... or China.

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: I guess we... owe you an apology.

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: Eh-ah, I guess we owe you one.

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: Awww.

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: Cartman? Cartman saved the day?

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: Can't be

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: The Founding Fathers want you all to know that we can disagree all we want, as long as we agree that America kicks ass.

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: Hey I'm a little bit country

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: And I'm a little bit rock-n-roll-eh

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: I'll be the muscle of America

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: And me, I'll be the caring soul.

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: When you put us together you get a nation with one goal

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
role: To thrive and prosper, with a little country and rock and roll.

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: Come on up here, everybody!

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: We're a little bit country, and we're a little bit rock-n-roll

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: We can be a nation that believe in war,

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: And still tells the world that we don't.

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: Let the flag for hyprocisy fly high from every pole

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
role: We're a little bit country, and we're a little bit rock-n-roll

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: Well, goodnight everybody. It sure has been great bringing you a hundred episodes.

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: We want to thank our guests, the pro-war people.  And the anti-war people.

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: What the hell are they doing now?

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: Ah I don't know.

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: For the war, against, the war, WHO CARES?? One hundred episodes!

title: I M A LITTLE BIT COUNTRY
text: I hate this town. Ah I really really do.
